editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: The Missal. F-28v: Opening Prayers to the Mass. F-50v: The Ordinary of the Mass, ሥርዓተ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ F-63v: Anaphora of the Apostles, Qǝddase Ḫawaryat, ቅዳሴ፡ ሐዋርያት፡. F-68r: Anaphora of Our Lord, ቅዳሴ፡ እግዚእ፡. See Mercer. F-77v: Anaphora of John, Son of Thunder, Qǝddase Yoḥannəs Wäldä Nägwädǝgwad, ቅዳሴ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ነጐድጓድ፡. F-87v: Anaphora of Our Lady Mary attributed to Cyriacus of Bəhənsa, Qǝddase Maryam Gwäs’a, ቅዳሴ፡ ማርያም፡. F-95r: Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers, Qǝddase za-Śäläsǝtu, ቅዳሴ፡ ዘሠለስቱ፡ ምዕት፡. F-104r: Anaphora of Athanasius, bishop of Alexandria, Qǝddase Atǝnatewos, ቅዳሴ፡ አትናቴዎስ፡. F-111r: Anaphora of Basil of Caesarea, Qǝddase Baslǝyos, ቅዳሴ፡ ባስልዮስ፡. F-116v: Anaphora of Gregory, brother of Basil, Qǝddase Gorǝgorǝyos, ‘Ǝḫǝwä Baslǝyos., ቅዳሴ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ እኅወ፡ ባስልዮስ፡. F-122r: Anaphora of Epiphanius, Qǝddase Epifanǝyos, ቅዳሴ፡ ኤጲፋንዮስ. F-126v: Anaphora of John Chrysostom, Qǝddase Yoḥannəs Afä Wärq, ቅዳሴ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈወርቅ፡. F-132r: Anaphora of Cyril of Alexandria, Qǝddase Qerǝlos, ቅዳሴ፡ ቄርሎስ፡. F-137v: Anaphora of Jacob of Serugh, Qǝddase Ya’ǝkob Zä-Śǝrug, ቅዳሴ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘሥሩግ፡. F-141v: Anaphora of Dioscorus, Qǝddase Diosǝqoros, ቅዳሴ፡ ዲዮስቆሮስ፡. F-144v: Anaphora of Gregory Nazanzia, ጎርጎርዮስ: ዘእንዚናዙ: Qeddase Telek, belonging to Prince Ras Tafari, baptismal name Ḫaylä Śǝllase

origin.origDate: 1917 EC = 1923-4 (colophon on f. 144v, mentions Ḫaylä Śǝllase, as owner, in the time of Empress Zewditu, Metropolitan Matewos, the Eccege, and others). Cf. 34v-35r which mentions Empress Zewditu and the leaders of the church. Date 1917EC.

revisionDesc.change: Created XML record from EMIP Collection Metadata.xsls
